alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Lawrence (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 10:40AM CST until February 06 at 1:42AM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for a portion of the following river in Indiana...Illinois... Wabash River, from Lafayette downstream to Riverton. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is low potential for flooding to develop during the second half of the week of January 28 at Vincennes. The river is rising at all locations south of Lafayette. Flooding could be made worse by any ice jams that develop during ice break up, but this threat is diminishing due to the amount of time air temperatures are spending above the freezing mark. River levels on the White River at Elliston, Edwardsport, Petersburg, and Hazleton will be monitored for possible upcoming flood warnings. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 6... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, February 6. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, High water surrounds elevated river cabins. County roads to these cabins are impassable. Agricultural flooding is in progress. Seep water develops behind levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Saturday /10:00 AM CST Saturday/ the stage was 15.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EST Saturday /10:00 AM CST Saturday/ was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.7 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday, February 5. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 545 AM EST /445 AM CST/.
